title: Hanging, 1875–1900
dimensions:
Warp: 249 cm [98"]
Weft: 132 cm [52"]
A trimming sewn on three sides and a flap of different material sewn to the top for hanging on a rod.  The left side has a selvedge.
creditline: Museum purchase from Eleanor G. Hewitt Fund
description: Two shades of green and gold with rows of medalions.  The bottom row of medalians is a male figure with wings holding two horses and the rest of  the medalians consists of a draped female in a boat with sail.

tombstone.epitaph:
Hanging, 1875–1900.Warp: 249 cm [98"]
Weft: 132 cm [52"]
A trimming sewn on three sides and a flap of different material sewn to the top for hanging on a rod.  The left side has a selvedge.. Museum purchase from Eleanor G. Hewitt Fund. 1993-110-1.
